title: Kevin Hart breaks silence on near-fatal car crash with emotional video
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Kevin Hart has broken his silence on his near-fatal car crash with an emotional video that goes through the stages of his recovery.

The comedian was involved in a gruesome car accident in the beginning of September which left the world shocked.

He was hospitalised with major back injuries, which was a miracle if you consider what the car looked like after.

The 40-year-old said: ‘Basically what you realise is that you’re not in control. No matter how much you think you’re in control, you’re not in control.

‘At the end of the day, it can all be over, man.’

While the actor spoke, the words ‘September 1, 2019, I was involved in an accident, my world changed forever’ appeared on the screen.

Kevin was in his Plymouth Barracuda with two other people when his car rolled into an embankment in Malibu Hills, California.

Kevin was discharged from the hospital 10 days after the crash to attend rehabilitation (Picture: Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP)

Nurses helped the star move from the hospital bed (Picture: Instagram/Kevin Hart)

The driver and the other passenger had to be cut out of the vehicle, with one person suffering major back injuries like Kevin did, and the other with no serious injuries at all.

Kevin’s emotional video began showing clips of him in the hospital, wearing a heavy back brace and breathing apparatus and being assisted out of bed by two nurses.

However, the Night School actor kept the clip positive, abruptly cutting to scenes of him doing physical therapy and getting stronger.

‘When God talks, you listen,’ he speaks in the video. ‘I swear, life is funny because some of the craziest things that happen to you end up being the things you needed most.

‘After my accident, I see things differently. I see life from a whole new perspective and my appreciation for life is through the roof.’

He still has to wear a brace and sits down most of the day (Picture: Instagram/Kevin Hart)

The car rolled through the embankment just yards from his house (Picture: Clint Brewer / BACKGRID)

Thanking his family, friends, and fans for supporting him, the tearjerking video cuts to footage of him and his family looking happy.

Kevin’s progress has been phenomenal if you take into account his serious accident was only two months ago.

The doctor did tell the star that recovery could take a year, but when you’re progressing like Kevin is, that’s amazing news.

Kevin will not be fully back to work until early 2020, according to his attorney Andrew Brettler, and will be focusing on his rehabilitation.
